definition: (lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
to pull/to draw/to pull back/to withdraw/to flash past

sentences.english: Let he be unlikely fore the line kills an enemy, back still must be subjected to Che elbow.
sentences.chinese: 让他不至于在前线杀敌，背后还得受着掣肘。

sentences.english: We're coming up on election time, and he has been repeatedly stymied by congress.
sentences.chinese: 选举季即将来临，但奥巴马总统却一直受到国会掣肘。

sentences.english: And it has restricted the healthy development of the life insurance industry seriously.
sentences.chinese: 寿险投资已严重掣肘了我国寿险业的健康发展。

definition: to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
large tail obstructs action (idiom); bottom heavy/fig. rendered ineffective by subordinates
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
